title: Chicken Tawa Fry
ingredients: Boneless Chicken, Yogurt, Coriender leaves, Turmeric Powder, Chilly Powder, Coriender Powder,Ginger Garlic Paste, Salt, Kasuri Methi, Gharam Masala, Cheese, Maggie masala(optional)
instructions: For the marination take a bowl and add boneless chicken, yogurt, chilly powder, a pinch of turmeric powder, gharam masala powder, coriender powder, ginger garlic paste, one cube of gratted cheese, crushed kasuri methi, chopped Coriender leaves and salt as per taste. Mix it well and keep it aside for atleast 20-30min. Then add oil/butter to the tawa and cook the chicken on both side.

title: Paneer Lababdar
ingredients: Paneer - 300 Gms, Oil - 1 Tbsp, Onion - 2 Nos (Chopped), Red Chilies - 10 Nos. Tomato - 3 Nos ChoppedSalt - 1 Tsp, Cashew Nuts - 1/4 Cup, Ghee - 3 Tsp, Kashmiri Chili Powder - 2 Tsp, Garam Masala - 1 Tsp, Kasuri Methi, Coriander Leaves, Unsweetened Khoya - 50 Gms, Milk - 3 Tbsp, Fresh Cream - 2 Tbsp, Sugar - 1 Tsp, Water - 1/4 Cup, Salt - 1 Tsp
instructions: 1. Heat some oil in a kadai, add onions, red chilies, tomatoes, and cashews and saute till they are completely cooked. 2. Add salt and cook till tomatoes are mushy. Turn off the stove.3. Cool the ingredients and grind them to a smooth paste. 4. Heat a kadai with ghee, add red chili powder.5. Pour in the ground paste and add a little water which was added to the mixer jar to remove the paste stuck to it.6. Now add garam masala, kasuri methi and chopped coriander leaves.7. Close the kadai and let it simmer for about 10 minutes on low flame.8. To a mixer jar, add khoya and milk. Grind them into a fine paste to give the curry a creamier texture.9. Add fresh cream, ground khoya mixture and sugar to the gravy and give it a quick mix.10. Add water, season the gravy with salt and mix it well.11. Now add paneer cubes to the gravy, close the kadai and cook for 10 minutes on low-flame. 12. Turn off the stove and serve it hot with a dollop of butter.

title: Anjal Rava Fry
ingredients: 4 – 5 pieces of king fish (Surmai ), 1 tsp ginger garlic paste, ½ tsp turmeric powder, 2 tsp of chilli powder, salt to taste, 2 – 3 tbsp tamarind water, 1 cup semolina, coconut oil for shallow frying
instructions: Prepare a masala by mixing together ginger garlic paste, turmeric powder, chilli powder, salt & tamarind water (by adding tamarind to hot water).In a frying pan heat some coconut oil and leave it on a low flame. Coat the fish with the prepared masala and then cover it with rava/semolina. Place the fish slices in the frying pan. Fry them for 5 to 7 mins in low flame, until they are cooked properly from both the sides. Once the fish is cooked take it off the gas and the dish is ready to be served!

title: Paneer Dum Biryani
ingredients: For Paneer Marination : Onion - 1 (large), Yogurt / Dahi - 3 tbsp, Chopped Coriander - 1 tbsp, Salt - 1/2 tsp, Sugar - 3/4 tsp, Kasoori methi - 1/4 tsp, Black Pepper - 1/4 tsp, Dried Mint - 1 pinch, Red Chili Powder - 1/4 tsp, Turmeric powder - 1/4 tsp, Cloves - 7 (crushed), Paneer - 250 g (diced). For Biryani : Oil - 2 tbsp, Ghee - 1 tbsp, Jeera - 1/2 tsp, Bay Leaf - 2, Green Cardamom - 5, Cloves - 4, Black Peppercorns - 1/4 tsp, Star Anise - 1, Onion - 1 (finely chopped), Salt - 1 tsp, Ginger Garlic Paste - 1/2 tbsp, Tomato - 1 large, Chili Powder - 1 tsp, Coriander Powder - 1 tsp, Garam Masala - 3/4 tsp, Kasoori methi - 1/4 tsp, Mint & Coriander Leaves - 1 Sprig, Pepper - 1/4 tsp, Sugar - 1/2 tsp. For Rice : Basmati Rice - 2 Cups, Oil from Birista, Salt to season
instructions: For Marination Birista : Slice 1 onion and separate the onion slices, add to a pan along with 3 tbsp oil. Fry in low flame stirring continuousl until light golden. Take down to a tissue paper and spread. And collect the oil to use for boiling rice. Chop the birista int smaller pieces. In a bowl, add in the birista, yogurt, coriander leaves, salt, sugar,kasoori methi, black pepper, dried mint, red chili powder turmeric powder and crushed cloves. Mix the marination well, add in the diced paneer cubes and stir gently. Cover and let it marinate for 1 hour. For Rice Soak rice for 1 hour. Boil 8 cups of water, add salt to season the water and oil from the birista. add the soaked rice and boil til 75% done. Drain the rice and spread in a plate. For Biryani Masala : In a pressure pan/cooker, add in the oil and ghee. Once hot, cumin seeds and after they sizzle, goes in cardamom pods cloves, peppercorns, bay leafs and star anise. Add in the chopped onions and cook till they start going golden, then add ginger garlic paste. Once raw flavor from ginger garlic i gone, add the chopped tomatoes and salt. Cook till the tomatoes are mushy, then add in : turmeric powder, black pepper, coriander powder, garam masala, red chili powder kasoori methi and sugar and cook for 2-3 minutes. Then add in coriander and mint leaves and stir. Pour in about a cup of water an get it to a boil. Switch off the flame, and begin layering the biryani. On top of this masala gravy, add in 1/2 of the cooked rice. Next goes in all o the marinated paneer, then rest of the rice. Pour in about 1/4 cup of water. You can add in some cashews or nuts if you wish, some saffron water can go in as well. Cover the pan with the lid and heat it up i medium flame for 3-4 minutes, then about 20 minutes in low flame. Let the biryani stay idle for a minimum of 30 minutes before opening. Open the pan, serve the biryani!

title: Paneer Chilli
ingredients: For Batter: 2 tbsp refined flour, 1 tbsp corn starch, A pinch of Sal, ¼ cup wate, 1 tbsp corn starch (for Coating paneer, 250 gms Paneer, cut in cubes, Oil to deep fry.\n For Chilli Paneer Sauce: 1 tbsp oil, 1 tbsp ginger, finely choppe, 1 tbsp garlic, finely choppe, 2 dry red chilli, roughly choppe, 1 tbsp celery, choppe, 1 medium onion, cut in quarters, 1 small capsicum, cut in cubes, 1 tbsp soy sauce, 2 fresh red & green chilli, slice, 1 tbsp green chilli sauc, 1 tbsp Sweet & Sour sauce, 1 tsp suga, 1 tbsp corn flour slurry (corn flour + water mixed), Handful of spring onion
instructions:
For Coating paneer add refined flour, corn flour, salt and water to a bowl, mix well and set aside till in use.
 Add the corn starch to the paneer cubes and coat well, pour over the prepared batter and mix well coating all the paneer cubes evenly.
 Deep fry the coated paneer cubes till light golden, drain on absorbent paper. Set aside till in use.
 Heat oil in a pan, add ginger, garlic, whole red chilli and celery. Mix well and sauté for a few minutes.
 Add onions and capsicum, sauté till onions are fragrant.
 Add soy sauce and toss well to coat.
 Add fresh red and green chillies, sauté for a few seconds.
 Add green chilli sauce, sweet & sour sauce, mix and toss well.
 Add little water, sugar and cook till it melts.
 Add some more water and the corn flour slurry, cook till the sauce thickens.
 Add the fried paneer cubes and spring onions, toss well.

title: Cheese-veg nachos
ingredients: Mozzarella Cheese - 200 Gms, Chopped Green Capsicum, Cooked Sweet Corn - 1 Cup, Italian Seasoning - 2 Tsp, Chilli Flakes - 1 Tsp, Pepper - 1/2 Tsp, Salt - 1/2 Tsp , Tomato Ketchup - 1 1/2 Tbsp
instructions: Grate the Mozzarella cheese and keep it aside. To a bowl, add green capsicum, cooked corn, grated mozzarella cheese, italian seasoning, Chilli flakes, pepper, and salt. Mix everything together. Now add tomato ketchup and mix again. On a plate, start placing the Nacho chips and spread it evenly. Add the topping generouly over the nacho chips. Place this plate over a pan and cover the pan. On low flame, let is cook for about 15 - 20 mins. Cheesy stringy vegetable nachos is ready.

title: Aloo Paratha
ingredients: Onion, Capsicum, Tomato, Paneer, Hung Curd, Coriender leaves, Turmeric Powder, Chilly Powder, Salt, Tikka Masala, Kasuri Methi, Gharam Masala
instructions: For the marination take a bowl and add Hung curd to it, add chilly powder, a pinch of turmeric powder, gharam masala powder, a spoon of tikka masala, crushed kasuri methi, chopped Coriender leaves and salt as per taste. Add diced veggies and paneer and mix it gently. Keep it aside for atleast 20-30min. Then insert the veggies and paneer to screwer and cook it directly in gas flame. Keep turning the screwer, apply butter on each side and your paneer tikka is ready.
